meanings.definition: The plural form of the noun 'valencia', referring to a type of orange.
meanings.sent1: I bought some juicy valencias at the market.
meanings.sent2: Valencias are known for their sweet taste.
meanings.sent3: Why did the valencias go to school? To become even juicier!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a basket of valencias.
meanings.sent5: The valencias glistened in the sunlight, tempting everyone passing by.

meanings.definition: The third person singular form of the verb 'valenciar', meaning to assign a valence to an atom or molecule.
meanings.sent1: He valencias the atoms in the lab every day.
meanings.sent2: Valencias help determine the reactivity of elements.
meanings.sent3: Why did the scientist break up with oxygen? It had too many valencias!
meanings.sent4: The valencias of the molecules danced together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent5: She carefully counted the valencias, ensuring the experiment's success.
